author: easterntownhall
title: Onboarding East Asia Today
description: Despite a population of billions, East Asia is underrepresented in Catalyst due to a lack of localized content and Town Hall participation.

f6_assessments.q0:
Ensuring the participation of People from different countries all over the world in the Catalyst is very important to have the Catalyst process as diversified and inclusive as possible. The main obstacle in achieving this is the language barrier that non-English speaking people face in reading the different documents related to Catalyst as the material is in English language. 
The proposal is trying to create a platform to translate Catalyst documents & proposals to various languages of the East Asia region. The objective is to first translate the existing Project Catalyst Fund series content into local language of the communities represented in Eastern Town Hall and later on it will be expanded to translate various existing Cardano and Catalyst material to these languages. The material will be converted using a semi-automated system which will include translating the material using a machine and then having it worked on by a multi-linguistic expert who will review it. This will make available a vide variety of Catalyst and Cardano related material to the communities in East Asia region and it will result in creation of a strong community of Catalyst participants who were not earlier able to participate in this governance initiative. This fulfills the objectives of this challenge and will help  have a well diversified and well representative Catalyst.
Only problem I see here is that they are translating the content in the local language of the communities represented in Eastern Town Hall only, but there are many other languages which are not yet represented in the Eastern Town Hall and they will be left out from this initiative. But as the mid term goal of the project is to expand it to other languages as well so I am hopeful that most of the popular languages of East Asian region will be covered by this initiative one day.
f6_assessments.q1: The project, among other things, broadly includes maintaining the translation material for GitHub and GitLocalize, managing communication and uploading periodic content to instagram and Twitter and maintaining and updating translated content to the East Town Hall website. This translated content will be marketted to a wider community, in and outside of Cardano by collaborating with communities/business entities that would benefit from having this type of service. The team consists of more than 10 members and many of them have experience as Cardano Ambassadors, memebers of Catalyst Swarm, veteran community advisors (now called vPAs) and many of them are stake pool operators from East Asia region. The team is requesting for funds of $17000  and looking at the breakup of the budget it looks quite reasonable. All these facts show that the project is feasible to complete and will be very impactful.
f6_assessments.q2:
Translated content and material uploaded to GitHub and GitLocalize, can be monitored directly on these wesites in real time. Similarly regular updates posted in local languags on instagram and Twitter can also be verified publically to track the progress being made by the team. All the translated content of Catalyst and Cardano is being uploaded to the East Town Hall website https://easterntownhall.com which is free to use for anyone. Updates are also  being provided in the  Eastern town hall meeting being conducted regularly. All this shows that monitoring and eventually auditing the project is relatively easy task as the required data and information is freely available in the public domain.

In the end I would add that they have described their long term goal as "having a  decentralized workflow for translation and interpretation of any document, video, podcast etc., using the Cardano Network as the coordinating backbone." And with these words, I wish them all the best.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem was brought up by the proposer who observed that East Asia was not adequately represented in Catalyst owing to the absence of locally relevant content and engagement from Townhall. Their answer is to establish up a translation pipeline in East Asia so that proposals and documents may be translated into a number of different languages. A straightforward approach based on Git, GitLocalize, and GitHub Actions was also put to the test. The team said that they had conducted trials of the process of semi-automatic translation in a number of nations, and that the outcomes had been deemed to be fairly successful. Aside from that, they also present certain concerns, such as the challenge of designing a system that strikes a balance between the level of community engagement, the quality of the translation, and the rate of translation. This is a solution that makes sense to me and is practical. When additional information, particularly content that is relevant to the East Asian community, is made available in relevant languages, the chances of active involvement and engagement by members of this community, as well as knowledge of Project Catalyst in this region, will increase.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project provides a detailed and all-encompassing road plan, as well as a schedule that will be followed.
The example of the success in translation from Indonesia is illuminating on the possibility of this kind of project, but I would want to see those proposing this initiative also cite examples from other nations. This information may be helpful to readers in determining whether or not other locations or nations have resources that are comparable to those described here. Evidence is shown at each step of the proposal to demonstrate the ongoing work that has been done and the results that have been achieved up to this point. The team and its members are already involved in this project. There are two teams that make up the project staff: the core team and the consultant team. Each member of both teams appears to have a high level of competence in relation to the requirements of the project. On the other hand, it would be helpful if there were references to individual profiles so that the community could comprehend the information better.
The budget is quite specific and easy to understand given the constraints of the time frame. The person who made the proposal has also thought about the problems that can arise during the implementation and has suggested potential solutions for such problems.
In light of the evidence presented here, the project appears to have a good chance of success.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers offer a monthly implementation plan that details the precise effort that has to be completed. When it comes to funding, I have no doubt that this initiative will be a smashing success.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is, in my assessments so far, a showcase proposal that is well deserving of the funding it requested.
1. the problem statement is absolutely clear, addresses the needs of the challenge it is submitted under, and aligned with the fund 9 strategic goals
2. it is a recurring proposal across past funds, since fund 6. they have a working website, an existing team working on it, and i have personally been to the Eastern Town Hall sessions myself and benefitted from the sessions. I am from east asia myself as well and i understand the difficulties of the local, non-native english speakers in my region. The impact that this proposal can achieve is already tangible, no doubt to that, and i am sure it brings enormous value to cardano with the participations it's received so far.
3. the methodology of translation is also semi automated, meaning that the way they work to achieve the desired impact is as efficient as it can get to ensure timely delivery of translations, yet in an accurate manner with quality. 
4. i am no technical person, but i appreciate that the team has attached links to their resource used like Git, GitLocalize, Github Actions, aligned with standards or established processes like Kubernetes SIG Docs
5. the team even shared data on past performance - time taken for translation in the indonesia community for al fund 7, 8 challenges, along with the accuracy/quality rates.
6. the risks highlighted is indeed valid and an obvious risk, considering their community driven approach of getting the translations done. this is a risk in the method of delivering the translation itself, but the team is indeed working on what is within their control, such as fine tuning rewards / compensation for incentives. as for the risk of participation from the community, i am sure the value proposition of the cardano blockchain itself and the projects building on it, will be desirable enough to attract the right audience.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is suitable for the given challenge. The issue that needs to be addressed here is that despite a population of billions, but East Asia has little representation in Catalyst due to a lack of localized content and City Hall involvement. The proposal also clearly states that it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem by establishing a translation system to accurately translate Catalyst documents and proposals into different East Asian languages. Suggested solutions are as follows: develop and document a streamlined process for translating content and start developing localized content. set up a simple translation pipeline using Git, GitLocalize, and GitHub Actions. translate many existing Cardano and Catalyst documents into three to four languages ​​of the existing community at East City Hall using a semi-automated system, while gaining experience and building community. Through the system of translations more and more individuals from the Eastern Hemisphere communities who do not usually speak English are beginning to understand what drives Cardano and Project Catalyst. Thereby helping to expand the scale of the project. From the above information, I completely agree that this proposal effectively addresses future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent also identified the team members as a diverse group with members of the core and advisory groups, relevant experiences, and skills required by each member of each group are also detailed by the proponent. The proponent thinks the budget is 17000 and offers a detailed budget breakdown along with clearly outlined 3-month action plans, broken down into definable items: Automated Workflow Optimization: $2,700. Workshops for community supporters: $720. Marketing and communications: $1,650. Website Maintenance: $1,500. Project Manager: $1,750. Project documentation and housekeeping: $1,000. Community Participation: $4,680. Translation fee: $3,680. NFT compensation creates different levels: $1,000. Software & Server Services: $3,000. The proponent has also considered the possible risks and has measures for each of those risks, from the information given I strongly agree that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proponent offers a roadmap for implementation in January, February, March, and December, with key milestones and specific timelines for achievement. When the project is successfully implemented, the Cardano community will have an additional reliable translation system to help translate, transcribe or interpret documents. The proponent has selected indicators: Key Indicators, Metrics activities, and Community Index as indicators to measure the progress of the project. The proponent clearly describes the underrepresentation of East Asia's problem in Catalyst due to the lack of localization content and City Hall involvement and offers a clear, easy-to-understand solution to the problem.  This proposal is a continuation of the proposal that East City Hall is continuously funded from Funds 6, 7, 8, and now 9 and this is also a plus point for the reliability and success rate of project work. So I totally agree that this proposal gives me enough information to gauge progress towards goals.
